sentences.sContent: Uncle Ted’s chair collapsed under his weight.
sentences.sCn: 椅子承受不了特德叔叔的重量，塌架了。

sentences.sContent: The roof had collapsed long ago.
...many of the world's largest banks feared the worst as the collapse of the housing bubble exposed in investments in risky loans...
...Some drew the wrong lesson from the collapse of the Soviet system in 1991...
...Predictions of the collapse of the tropical rain forests have been around for years...
...they had a tendency to collapse under the weight of extra grain - a trait called lodging...
...If the collapse of the rain forests speeds up dramatically...
...A prime example Schweitzer and his colleagues cite is the 2004 collapse of energy-trading giant Enron...

phrases.pCn: 损毁荷载，极限载荷；破坏负荷；临界纵向荷载

remMethod.val: col(表加强) ＋ lapse(滑倒) → 彻底滑倒 → 崩溃

trans.tranOther: if a building, wall etc collapses, it falls down suddenly, usually because it is weak or damaged
